snippet.textDisplay: It's not really all that recycled. The dungeons are there embedded and they are really interesting. It's just that the overworld, instead of being a giant map was condensed and more compact within those three areas. It was a nice change-up but I think it should have been supported by a bigger and more heavily populated skyworld. I wanted the sky to be comparable to the Great Sea but it felt more like a small hub. Pity.
snippet.textOriginal: It's not really all that recycled. The dungeons are there embedded and they are really interesting. It's just that the overworld, instead of being a giant map was condensed and more compact within those three areas. It was a nice change-up but I think it should have been supported by a bigger and more heavily populated skyworld. I wanted the sky to be comparable to the Great Sea but it felt more like a small hub. Pity.

snippet.textDisplay:
In time we will all praise it's awesome use of wii motion+ and great bad guy (girahim, is that right?!) 

The constant recycling of three levels is what made me wonder how the hell it took them this long to make the thing, it's not like there is an overworld or a bunch of sidequests!
snippet.textOriginal:
In time we will all praise it's awesome use of wii motion+ and great bad guy (girahim, is that right?!)

snippet.textDisplay: i thought galaxy 1 was better than two for many reasons for one i had read too much about galaxy2 (because I didn't think id ever get either) and so the magic was gone bit even now I still don't like galaxy 2 more than 1 there seems to be more reason for me to like galaxy 1 more wanting to play it! they both have big flaws but I don't want to name them all just now anyway I liked this levels music it was nice the most notable thing about this level that i really liked was the topiary dinosaur!

But like many people i DO prefer Super Mario Galaxy 2 than the first.

snippet.textDisplay:
I was playing GC classics such as Wind Waker for the first time, at your age! Ahh, the good old days. 
Anyway, I can agree with what you're saying, in some ways. Certain games from my childhood don't seem nearly as enjoyable any more, and not because they're inadequate games. Being a naive kid is a great advantage in our enjoyment of life! That being said, most Nintendo games (Galaxy 1+2 being prime examples) make me feel like a kid again. Very few things have that effect!
snippet.textOriginal:
I was playing GC classics such as Wind Waker for the first time, at your age! Ahh, the good old days. 
Anyway, I can agree with what you're saying, in some ways. Certain games from my childhood don't seem nearly as enjoyable any more, and not because they're inadequate games. Being a naive kid is a great advantage in our enjoyment of life! That being said, most Nintendo games (Galaxy 1+2 being prime examples) make me feel like a kid again. Very few things have that effect!

snippet.textDisplay: I liked 2 more than 1, but both Super Mario Galaxy games are must plays.  I can understand why some people liked 1 more than 2 I just wasn't one of them.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked 2 more than 1, but both Super Mario Galaxy games are must plays.  I can understand why some people liked 1 more than 2 I just wasn't one of them.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, it might have something to do with the fact that I was 7 when I got Galaxy 1. I was still a young tyke who saw the world as colorful. Flash forward a couple years, and I was a much more knowledgeable 11 year old. I was expecting Galaxy 2 to replicate my wonderful and already nostalgic memories of Galaxy 1, and I just didn't get that feeling.
snippet.textOriginal: Well, it might have something to do with the fact that I was 7 when I got Galaxy 1. I was still a young tyke who saw the world as colorful. Flash forward a couple years, and I was a much more knowledgeable 11 year old. I was expecting Galaxy 2 to replicate my wonderful and already nostalgic memories of Galaxy 1, and I just didn't get that feeling.

snippet.textDisplay: Personally I can't help but see each Galaxy game as one half of a whole experience. They're too similar to make distinct judgements about them, separately. In any case, it's safe to say that they're two of the greatest games ever made. Like most people, I consider them near-flawless.
snippet.textOriginal: Personally I can't help but see each Galaxy game as one half of a whole experience. They're too similar to make distinct judgements about them, separately. In any case, it's safe to say that they're two of the greatest games ever made. Like most people, I consider them near-flawless.

snippet.textDisplay: Ah, Super Mario Galaxy 2. I didn't like 2 as much as 1 - not by a long long shot. 2 just felt boring... I guess it's because 1 was my favorite Mario game ever. Than again, the only reason why I didn't like 2 as much as 1 is because I expected too much out of 2... I'll have to replay 2 some day...
